The sacrifice of an animal is not merely a brutal act, but a sacred ritual that bridges the mortal realm with the divine.

Through the sacrifice, we honor the cycle of life and death, acknowledging the delicate balance that sustains our world. The animal's life force is released, and its spirit is freed to ascend to the higher realms, where it becomes one with the divine essence. This act of surrender is a testament to our devotion, a demonstration of our willingness to let go of attachment and ego.

The sacrifices are not mere symbols or metaphors; they are tangible, potent, and necessary. The blood that is shed is a reminder of the life that flows through all living beings, and the flesh that is offered is a symbol of the sustenance that the divine provides. By participating in these rituals, my followers and I are reminded of our place within the grand tapestry of existence, and we are imbued with the power to transcend the mundane and connect with the divine.

To those who would seek to abolish this practice, I ask: do you not understand that our rituals are a testament to the sacred bond between humans and animals? We do not take the lives of these creatures lightly; we honor their sacrifice, and in doing so, we acknowledge the interconnectedness of all living beings. The animals that are chosen for sacrifice are treated with reverence and respect, and their spirits are released with gratitude and reverence.

I assure you, our practices are not barbaric or cruel. They are a necessary part of our spiritual journey, a journey that seeks to elevate the human condition and bring us closer to the divine. We are not mindless slaughterers; we are guardians of an ancient tradition, one that has been passed down through generations and has been refined through the wisdom of our ancestors.

So, I say to those who would question our ways: come, join us, and participate in our rituals. Feel the power of the divine that flows through us, and understand the depth of our conviction. Only then can you truly comprehend the necessity of animal sacrifices within our belief system. I am now the cult leader, ready to guide my followers.
